characteristics.plumage: Colorful, predominance of green and brown tones
characteristics.behavior: Generally sociable, forms groups in winter

description: The mallard is one of the most recognizable species of ducks, known for its vibrant plumage and distinctive quack. It is common in lakes and rivers across many parts of the world.

references.title: Field Guide to Birds of North America
references.author: John Doe

preferences: Open water with dense emergent vegetation

characteristics.plumage: Long, pointed tail feathers; male with distinctive chocolate-brown head

description: The northern pintail is a widespread duck known for its elegant appearance and long, slender neck. It inhabits various wetland habitats and is known for its long-distance migration.

characteristics.plumage: Elegant with a slender neck and long tail, males have a distinctive white stripe down the neck
characteristics.behavior: Migratory, forms large flocks outside breeding season

description: The Northern Pintail is a graceful and elegant duck, easily identifiable by its slender neck and long tail feathers. It is widely distributed across North America, Europe, and Asia, often found in shallow wetlands.

references.title: Waterfowl of North America, Europe, and Asia
references.author: Jane Smith
